title: [K-12] Instructional Design for Integrating Conceptual and Procedural Knowledge in Fraction Division

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental fraction operations and experience in solving mathematical problems
context.additional_context: Blended Learning Environment Combining Online (Concept Explanations, Asynchronous Discussions) and Offline (Hands-On Activities, Feedback Sessions). Learners Engage in Activities Explicitly Expressing Mathematical Thinking Processes

learning_goals: Learners can integrate conceptual understanding and procedural approaches when explaining solutions to fraction division problems.

Learners can identify three typical error types in fraction division (lack of conceptual understanding, insufficient procedural memorization, and disconnected reasoning) and propose correction strategies.
Learners can explain the conceptual basis of the 'multiplying by the reciprocal' procedure through visual modeling (area/length models).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
